article_title: With high uninsured rate, Miami-Dade faces health crisis, report says
article_text:
01:19

'Narrow window of opportunity' to keep Zika from spreading, says CDC

article_metadata.news-keywords: Miami, Miami-Dade, Florida, uninsured, health insurance, coverage, Medicaid expansion, Affordable Care Act
article_metadata.description: Miami-Dade has a high rate of uninsured residents, a growing number of new HIV/AIDS cases, and more deaths from heart disease and diabetes than Florida averages, says consumer group advocating for Medicaid expansion. The state’s refusal to expand Medicaid will be more costly, particularly for Miami-Dade hospitals, which will lose more than $241 million this year due to a severe reduction in federal funding for uninsured patients, the report contends.
article_metadata.title: With high uninsured rate, Miami-Dade faces health crisis, report says | Miami Herald
